Articles.Content:
Similar to /r/showerthoughts,  but here on the forums!

"Showerthought" is a loose term that applies to the types of thoughts you might have while carrying out a routine task like showering, driving, or daydreaming. At their best, showerthoughts are universally understood and find the amusing/interesting within the mundane.

-/r/showerthoughts

Post away!
"CDs are just legible donuts that computers can read." -The Raging Sandwich, just now
We can mine Titan for oil (or, rather, hydrocarbons). Oil is used for much more than fuel, after all...

Any number b represented in base b is "10." That is, b = 10b for all values of b

Edited February 13, 2017 by 0111narwhalz
Praise the subscript. Praise it!
I will definetly try to difine definetely while also misspelling difinitly in the most undefenite ways.

I guess I can deifinity spell definatly. 

 

Dog goes woof
Cat goes meow
Bird goes tweet
And mouse goes squeak
Cow goes moo
Frog goes croak
And the elephant goes toot
Ducks say quack
And fish go blub
And the seal goes ow ow ow

But there's one sound
That no one knows
What does the turtle say?

1 hour ago, max_creative said:

What does the turtle say?

(I'm sorry, but it had to be done.)

Many yogurt containers feature the words "Contains Live Active Cultures." Does this mean that some yogurt contains live, but inactive cultures? Or dead, inactive cultures?
Or even dead active cultures?

My showerthoughts are usually around some preposterous musings over how I would react....if I saw soviet paratroopers descending outside my window. I know, I know. 

#Wolverines!

Honourable mention goes to wondering how likely it is that I will get a text one morning telling me not to come into work because the office was hit by a freak meteorite.

1 hour ago, p1t1o said:

Honourable mention goes to wondering how likely it is that I will get a text one morning telling me not to come into work because the office was hit by a freak meteorite.

Probably, unlikely. Afaik from the forum, if a meteorite hits your workplace, you will know about that from sirens of a chemical contamination alert, and strange people in funny rubber suits.
"If you're standing on the ground, you're still in orbit."
Would an aerosol based laxative be considered a bioweapon?
My shower's temperate lever has been working for in the opposite direction for years now...

People say humans are stupid nowadays, but being able to calculate 3x3 in a fraction on a second, is pretty intelligent right?

If the universe is infinite and has infinite possibilities, does that mean that there is a planet in the universe with Dank Memes written on it?

Is there a person thinking the same exact same thing i am thinking right now that does not know me?

Can i make drawings from my mind as good as drawings drawn from pictures?

Is there a absolute perfect and efficient rocket engine design out there, that has not been found yet?

 

- All by me.

Edited February 14, 2017 by NSEP
I wonder if the planets on the other side of the equator spin the other way around...

The word human ultimately comes from the Latin word "homo", which is related to the Latin word "humus", which means soil/ground/earth. Even the ancients knew we were born from the Earth... Which we now know was born from star stuff.....
